summary: Single-page interactive Valentine's Day web page with playful/mischievous tone (pink/white theme, heart animations, Yes/No interaction, popup, parallax hearts) targeting Chrome on iPad, with a constraint to include/display only one image.
architectural_notes: Target compatibility: Chrome on iPad (mobile/touch-friendly interactions).
Use clean HTML/CSS/JavaScript with minimal/no external dependencies.
known_issues: User requested removing an image from the site (image not specified; likely the displayed/generated meme asset).

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine‚Äôs Day experience with a playful, mischievous tone and a consistent pink-and-white visual design, including heart motifs and creative (but performant) animations.

Implement two prominent call-to-action buttons: a static ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button with a subtle shimmering effect, and a ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button that flees the cursor/pointer on hover/approach to be comedically difficult to click.

When the user clicks the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button, reveal the custom Drakeposting-format meme image that includes the text ‚ÄúGood choice ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù. The meme must replace the disapproving panel with a sad, pixelated heart and the approving panel with a vibrant, animated happy heart.

If the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button is clicked, show a semi-transparent popup overlay with a blurred background effect. The popup must display the text ‚ÄúAre you REALLY sure? ü§î‚Äù with a tiny shaking animation applied to the popup content.
Implement a parallax-style animated background with multiple layers of heart shapes floating upward at varying speeds and sizes to create depth, compatible with Chrome on an iPad.

Ensure the page uses minimal dependencies and is implemented with clean, maintainable HTML/CSS/JavaScript patterns within the React+TypeScript project, prioritizing compatibility with Chrome on an iPad.
Add the required generated image asset(s) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them directly from the frontend (do not route images through the backend).

Remove the image currently rendered in the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù flow (the in MemeReveal that loads /assets/generated/drakeposting-hearts-meme.dim_900x600.gif) so it is no longer displayed anywhere on the site, while keeping the rest of the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù reveal experience functional (headline and supporting text can remain).
Remove any now-unused references to the removed meme image asset in the frontend codebase and ensure there are no dead links to it (including alt text, preload hints, or other references).

Add exactly one generated static image asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it in the Valentine‚Äôs Day single-page experience (no additional images may be added or displayed anywhere else in the app).

Verify and enforce that there are no remaining references to any other image assets in the frontend (including dead links, preload hints, or unused imports), so the app uses/display only the single image added in REQ-10.

Enable changing/setting the app‚Äôs deployment domain name again, and validate the domain against the platform rules (5‚Äì50 characters; only letters, numbers, and hyphens). If the provided domain is invalid, show a clear English validation error indicating the rule that was violated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create single-page Valentine's Day interactive webpage with playful/mischievous tone and pink/white heart-themed styling
Add prominent 'Yes' button with subtle shimmering effect and static positioning
Add 'No' button that flees cursor/hover to be comedically difficult to click
On 'Yes' click, display custom Drakeposting-format meme: 'Good choice ‚ù§Ô∏è' with sad pixelated heart (disapproving) and vibrant animated happy heart (approving)
If 'No' is clicked, show semi-transparent popup with blurred background, text 'Are you REALLY sure? ü§î', and tiny shaking animation
Implement parallax background with multiple layers of differently sized hearts floating upward at varying speeds
Ensure implementation uses clean HTML/CSS/JS with minimal dependencies and is compatible with Chrome on iPad
Restrict the page to using/displaying only one image (ensure only a single image asset is included/rendered across the experience)
Allow changing/setting the deployment domain name again (must meet platform constraints: 5‚Äì50 chars, only letters/numbers/hyphens)

projectName: Single-page interactive Valentine‚Äôs Day page with fleeing No button, shimmering Yes button, meme reveal, and parallax hearts
